meanings.sent1: The city's decadence was evident in the crumbling buildings and neglected parks.
meanings.sent2: The historian attributed the fall of the empire to moral decadence among its leaders.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show humorously portrayed the decadence of modern fashion trends.
meanings.sent4: The decadence of the once-thriving neighborhood was like watching a flower wilt.
meanings.sent5: The decadence of the society was a slow but steady erosion of values and traditions.

meanings.definition: Excessive indulgence in pleasure or luxury
meanings.sent1: Her decadence knew no bounds as she indulged in lavish spa treatments every week.
meanings.sent2: The decadence of the banquet was evident in the abundance of gourmet dishes and fine wines.
meanings.sent3: His decadence in buying designer clothes was both impressive and concerning.
meanings.sent4: The decadence of the cruise ship's amenities made it feel like a floating palace.
meanings.sent5: The decadence of the feast left everyone feeling both satisfied and guilty.

meanings.definition: A period of decline or decay
meanings.sent1: The once grand mansion now stood as a symbol of decadence and neglect.
meanings.sent2: The decadence of the ancient ruins hinted at a glorious past now lost to time.
meanings.sent3: The town's annual festival marked the beginning of its slow decadence into obscurity.
meanings.sent4: The decadence of the old factory mirrored the decline of the town's industrial era.
meanings.sent5: The decadence of the forest was a poignant reminder of nature's cycle of growth and decay.
